etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Andrew Pritchard (1804–1882), microscopist. From crypto- + monad

definitions: Any of a group of flattened elliptical flagellates, formerly regarded as protozoans by zoologists or as green algae by botanists, and typically characterized by chloroplasts and two flagella.

notes.text: Now often treated as the protist phylum Cryptomonada (or Cryptophyta).
